abstract.text: A light that has a direction and is located at infinite distance, so its rays are parallel. It simulates the sun light and can cast shadows.
Enable/Disable shadow casting for this light
Default value: false.
Information about a light
Unique light name
Defines font family for the style from predefined options.
A global directional light source which is only applied on 3D and hillshade layers. Using this type disables other light sources.
Switch between 4 time-of-day states: dusk, dawn, day and night.
Map color theme.

A protocol describing a style-related entity that can be encoded.

Direction of the light source specified as [a azimuthal angle, p polar angle] where a indicates the azimuthal angle of the light relative to north (in degrees and proceeding clockwise), and p indicates polar angle of the light (from 0 degree, directly above, to 180 degree, directly below).
Default value: [210,30]. Minimum value: [0,0]. Maximum value: [360,90].
Specifies the position at which a layer will be added when using

Determines the shadow strength, affecting the shadow receiver surfaces final color. Values near 0.0 reduce the shadow contribution to the final color. Values near to 1.0 make occluded surfaces receive almost no directional light. Designed to be used mostly for transitioning between values 0 and 1.
Default value: 1. Value range: [0, 1]
Switch between predefined themes or set a custom theme.

uses colorTheme from the style or not.
By default it will use color defined by the root theme in the style.

The
control timing for the interpolation between a transitionable style
property’s previous value and new value. These can be used to define the style default property
transition behavior. Also, any transitionable style property may also have its own
property that defines specific transition timing for that specific layer property, overriding
the global transition values.
The name of the projection to be used for rendering the map.
A protocol used to create any type of  map style content, such as layers, sources, lighting and others.
